lines.text: Mr. Champion, my grandfather was the Secretary of War to Harrison. His brother was the governor of the state of New York. My brother-in-law is Secretary of State. And to you, I represent the full authority of the government of the United States and the President.
You're not my class, Canton, and you never will be. You'd have to die first and be born again.
It's gettin' dangerous to be poor in this country.
Do you think a woman can love two men?
Sure you can. Why not three? But it sure as hell isn't convenient.
Why don't you come in for a while? You haven't been here for a long time. I fixed the place up inside.
What have you done to it?
James, do you remember the good gone days?
Clearer and better, every day I get older.
Do you know what I really dislike about you, Jim? You're a rich man with a good name. You only pretend to be poor.
I never cheated on you. I always made Nate pay.
They're an ignorant, degraded gang of paupers. Their only stock in trade consists of having large numbers of ragged kids.
If we fail, the flag of the United States will fail.
Pie? I think it's the best one I ever did.
It's beautiful. It belongs in a museum.
